profileText: a Representative from Colorado; born Patricia Nell Scott in Portland, Multnomah County, Oreg., July 30, 1940; graduated from Roosevelt High School, Des Moines, Iowa, 1958; B.A., University of Minnesota, Minneapolis, Minn., 1961; J.D., Harvard Law School, Cambridge, Mass., 1964; lawyer, private practice; lawyer, National Labor Relations Board, 1964-1966; teacher, 1969-1972; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-third and to the eleven succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1973-January 3, 1997); chair, Select Committee on Children, Youth and Families (One Hundred Second and One Hundred Third Congresses); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fifth Congress in 1996; died on March 13, 2023, in Celebration, Fla.; interment at Congressional Cemetery, Washington, D.C., remains were cremated.

researchRecord.description: The Patricia Schroeder Papers encompass the extensive record of Schroeder’s political career, including press clips, committee reports, and other various documents pertaining to issues of particular concern to her (particularly women’s rights). Some personal and political correspondence is also included. A finding aid is available online.
